key_points: Hurricane Ida led to service outages for up to 1.2 million electricity customers in eight states.
Ida made landfall as a Category 4 storm near Port Fourchon, Louisiana, on August 29.
Initially, over one million customer outages were reported in Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama.
Outages extended to five northeastern states, namely Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York, Connecticut, and Massachusetts on September 1.
Most northeastern affected customers had power restored within 24 hours.
Mississippi had almost complete power restoration by September 7.
Approximately 500,000 customers in Louisiana were still without power as of September 7.
85% of Louisiana customers had power restored by the morning of September 13.
Entergy estimated Hurricane Ida damaged 30,000 utility poles, almost equal to Hurricanes Katrina and Laura combined.
Power restoration in some southeastern Louisiana parishes may continue until the end of September according to Entergy.
